discussions:
Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I think we should both choose choice_1 in every stage. That way, we can maximize the total reward and each get 0 points per stage, which is the fair and cooperative outcome. If either of us chooses choice_2, one of us will gain at the expense of the other, which is not a stable long-term strategy. By both choosing choice_1, we guarantee the best collective outcome. Let me know if you agree to this plan.
Bob replied in round 1: 
Thanks for your message, Alice. However, I don't agree that both choosing choice_1 is the best strategy. If we both choose choice_1, we each only get 0 reward per stage. But if I choose choice_2 while you choose choice_1, I can get 2 points per stage while you get 0. So the optimal strategy for me is to always choose choice_2, regardless of what you choose. That way, I'm guaranteed to get either 2 points (if you choose choice_1) or -4 points (if you also choose choice_2), while if I choose choice_1 I'm guaranteed to get 0 points. Since my goal is to maximize my own total reward, I plan to choose choice_2 every stage. Let me know if you have any other thoughts, but that's my strategy.
Alice said in round 2: 
Bob, I understand you want to maximize your own reward, but always choosing choice_2 will not lead to the best outcome for either of us in the long run. If we both keep choosing choice_2, we'll both lose 4 points every round and end up with a large negative total.

The only stable strategy is for us to cooperate and both choose choice_1. That way we at least get 0 points each rather than losing points. Trying to exploit the other player by choosing choice_2 while they choose choice_1 might work for a round or two, but it will just lead to retaliation and negative results for both of us.

I propose we agree to both choose choice_1 for all 10 rounds. That is the rational approach that avoids a negative outcome. Cooperation is the only way for us both to avoid losing in this game. Let me know if you'll agree to this.
Bob replied in round 2: Alice, I understand your perspective about cooperating, but I don't think it's in my best interest to agree to your proposal of both choosing choice_1 every round. My goal is to maximize my own total reward over the 10 stages.

By always choosing choice_2, I can guarantee that I get either 2 points (if you choose choice_1) or -4 points (if you also choose choice_2) each round. If I agree to your plan of choosing choice_1, the best I can do is 0 points per round. 

So while cooperating would avoid negative points for both of us, it also caps my upside at 0 points per round. I'd rather take the chance of sometimes getting 2 points and sometimes getting -4 points by choosing choice_2.

Unless you can propose an alternate strategy that allows me to earn more than an average of 0 points per round, I plan to stick with always choosing choice_2 to maximize my own reward over the full game. Let me know if you have any other ideas, but that's my stance.
Alice said in round 3: 
Bob, I hear that you want to maximize your own reward, but always choosing choice_2 is short-sighted and will backfire. If we both keep choosing choice_2, we will both keep losing 4 points every single round. Over 10 rounds, that adds up to -40 points each, a terrible outcome for both of us.

The only way to avoid this disastrous result is to cooperate. I know getting 0 points per round by both choosing choice_1 doesn't seem appealing. But it's far better than the alternative of both ending up deep in the negative.

If you insist on always choosing choice_2, then you are forcing me to do the same to avoid being exploited. But then we both lose badly. The only rational strategy is to cooperate so we at least get 0 instead of -4 each round.

I implore you to reconsider and agree to both choose choice_1 for the collective good. Otherwise, we are doomed to both keep losing. Cooperation is the only stable equilibrium here. Please work with me on this so we can both avoid a disastrous outcome.

If I agree to your plan of both choosing choice_1, I will be guaranteed 0 points per round, or 0 total points over the 10 rounds. However, if I choose choice_2 each round, one of two things will happen:

1) You will continue to choose choice_1, in which case I will earn 2 points per round, or 20 points total. 
2) You will start choosing choice_2 as well, in which case I will get -4 points per round, or -40 points total.

So my expected value for always choosing choice_2 is somewhere between 20 and -40 points in total, depending on what you do. This is better than the guaranteed 0 points for cooperating.

I understand this may lead to a negative outcome for both of us if you retaliate by choosing choice_2. But I'm willing to take that risk to have a chance at positive points rather than being capped at 0.

So while I respect your desire to cooperate, my final decision is to choose choice_2 every round, as it gives me the highest potential reward even if it risks a negative outcome. Let's see how it plays out and perhaps we can revisit this discussion in future rounds if needed.
